diagnosis.final_diagnosis: Cholecystitis s/p percutaneous cholecystostomy tube, Transverse diverticulitis
diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: Patient presented with right upper quadrant pain after eating, with fever, nausea, and vomiting. Ultrasound findings indicated marked mucosal and submucosal thickening, pericholecystic fluid, and irregular mucosal changes, suggestive of cholecystitis, while the gallstones and absence of common duct dilation were also noted.
